text:
First of all, we would like to thank you for participating in this experiment. We are carrying out non-profit research at Delft University of Technology to understand how people experience online videos. In this experiment, we ask you to fill out a demographic questionnaire, then spend some time watching a video and afterwards answer some questions.

By accepting this Task, you agree that:

We may publish excerpts of your answers for scientific articles;
This experiment will record your interactions;
We will NOT publish any information that could be linked to you.

Note on answering questions:

There are no absolute wrong or right answers for this task. What we ask is for you to give us your opinions related to the video that you watch.

PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS NO WAY TO GO BACK ONCE YOU CLICK THE CONTINUE BUTTON!

Task duration:
The whole experiment takes about 5 minutes.

Contact information:
You can always contact the requester for this Task at y.zhu-1@tudelft.nl. Please make sure you include the title of the Task when sending an email to this address.

Please Type your name here
comment: If you would like to participate in this experiment, please click CONTINUE

text:
Instructions

This task consists in completing an experiment that will help us in our research at Delft University of Technology.

It consists in 3 parts:

First, we will ask you fill out a questionnaire about yourself and your preferences for online video watching. Please answer the questions honestly. Data will be anonymized and kept in a secure server for further analysis.

Second, you will watch two sample videos, for training, i.e., to get you to practice your main task.

Finally, you will watch the actual test video. The video lasts around 1 minute. We require that you watch the entire video clip. After watching the test video, we will ask you to answer some questions about how you experienced the video.

The Microworkers payment code will be provided to you once you have completed all three steps.

General feedback
If you encounter any problems with this task or have any other comments, please report them here. You can also use this textbox to tell us if you liked this Task or have any suggestions.
comment: PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS NO WAY TO GO BACK ONCE YOU CLICK THE CONTINUE BUTTON!

text:
Part 1 Demographic Questionnaire

What is your age?
What is your gender?
What is your nationality?
How often do you watch online videos?

What is the resolution of your screen (in pixels, for example: 1280*720)?
Please write "DK" if you don't know the answer
Are you interested in sports video?
Are you interested in comedy video?
Are you interested in education video?

General feedback
If you encounter any problems with this task or have any other comments, please report them here. You can also use this textbox to tell us if you liked this Task or have any suggestions.
comment: PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS NO WAY TO GO BACK ONCE YOU CLICK THE CONTINUE BUTTON!

text:
Part 2 Personality Questionnaire


In the following part, there are a number of statements referring to personality traits that may or may not apply to you. Please mark the extent to which you agree or disagree with each statement, as honestly as possible. These data will not be distributed and will be used in a fully anonymized form for research purposes only.

If you have troubles understanding the terms, please indicate it in the textbox below.

I see myself as

Extraverted, enthusiastic
Critical, quarrelsome
Dependable, self-disciplined
Anxious, easily upset
Open to new experiences, complex
Reserved, quiet
Sympathetic, warm
Disorganized, careless
Calm, emotionally stable
Conventional, uncreative

General feedback
If you encounter any problems with this task or have any other comments, please report them here. You can also use this textbox to tell us if you liked this Task or have any suggestions.
comment: PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS NO WAY TO GO BACK ONCE YOU CLICK THE CONTINUE BUTTON!

text:
Part 3 Training


In this Part you will watch 2 sample videos. The first video represents an example of high video quality. The second video represents an example of low video quality. The second video will not be played until you finished the first video. After watching these two videos, there is one sample question to help you get familiar with our test questionnaire.

Please click the '>' button to play the video

Sample High Quality

If you have difficulties watching the video, you can try to refresh by clicking here.

General feedback
If you encounter any problems with this task or have any other comments, please report them here. You can also use this textbox to tell us if you liked this Task or have any suggestions.

text:
Part 3 Training


Sample Questions

This are two sample question from the questionnaire we will ask you to fill in after you watched the main video (next step). This is for you to practice with the question answering. Please answer the question referring to the last video you saw.

The video clip was enjoyable
Did you perceive any visual impairments in the video (for example: blur, ringing or blockiness)?

text: The Training part is over. Please click continue to start the actual experiment

Part 4 Watching the test video


After watching the whole video, please click continue to enter the last part. Please note you are requested to finish watching the ENTIRE video.

If you have difficulties watching the video, you can try to refresh by clicking here.

General feedback
If you encounter any problems with this task or have any other comments, please report them here. You can also use this textbox to tell us if you liked this Task or have any suggestions.
comment: PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS NO WAY TO GO BACK ONCE YOU CLICK THE CONTINUE BUTTON!

text:
Part 5 Video Experience Questionnaire


In this part, you will be asked to fill out several questions related to your experience with the video you just watched. We are interested about your experience with this video ONLY. Please answer all questions honestly.

The video clip was enjoyable
The quality of the video was:
I would recommend this video clip to my friends
I was satisfied with the experience in watching this video clip
When I was watching the video, I still paid attention to the world around me
Did you perceive any visual impairments in the video?
The video was exciting

What did you see in the video?
for example: a bird or a man

General feedback
If you encounter any problems with this task or have any other comments, please report them here. You can also use this textbox to tell us if you liked this Task or have any suggestions.
